intro: Ecclinusa colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian ecclinusa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly hairy texture. Ecclinusa colombiana is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments at moderate altitudes.
